website_summaries.verdict: With its reliability, its overall ease of use, and its undeniable value, the iSmartAlarm is an intriguing, legitimate alternative in home security, especially for small-home owners and budget-minded consumers.
pros: iSmartAlarm offers comprehensive and intelligent home security for do-it-yourself-minded consumers, all for a fraction of fee-based home security set-up
cons: This alarm system won't call the police for you, and getting the iCamera video add-on to work with the system can be a challenge

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WORK DURING THE HOLIDAYS
customer_reviews.text: Every year during holidays, I guess iAlarm serves can't handle the demand; I come home and I cannot DISARM the system. I have tried to wait, but to no avail. Tried having other users try to disarm and nothing. So invariably I open the door the alarm goes off and the only thing I can do is pull to cord out to disconnect... this is annoying and un-reliable, precisely when you need it the most, during the holidays.... As soon as the holidays comes, we notice I huge drop in the response time when you arm or disarm the system... iAlarm you've GOT TO FIX THIS.....
customer_reviews.author: Oscar O.

customer_reviews.title: It's worthless, dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy it!!!!!!!!!!!!! I bought it a few years ago and I worked great, however for the last few months it's been full of system bugs, at first all the notifications stopped working, then there were times when it went offline for a few minutes, but it went back online again. Yesterday it went and havent been able to get it to work again basically I have no security at home at all, I tried calling customer service and nobody answers the phone. I researched online and I am not the only one having this problem.
customer_reviews.author: N Z

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product. Major connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Major connectivity issues. Customer service is nonexistent. I have sent an email, submitted a “ticket” and tried calling customer service for 5 days in a row now. I have not been able to reach anyone or get a response. Garbage all the way around. Go elsewhere for a security system!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer support and product
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the worst customer support! I meticulously followed the instructions in the setup manual. Both remote tags had issues connecting, and I had to buy a special tiny screwdriver from a hardware store and open the casing just to reset the battery (instructed by customer support). Customer support was no help at all, the worst ever! Even after I got it working, on my own, the "arm" button on one of the remote tag was defective. Customer support only asked for a receipt to "maybe" send a replace tag. If you want to deal with a lot of hassles and use with a sub-par product, then this is the purchase for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Lo

customer_reviews.title: After trying three home secuity systems, iSmartAlarm is the best for features and cost.
customer_reviews.text: We bought and returned two other Amazon lower cost security packages which were disappointing. This iSmartAlarm home security package is VERY easy to install and goes to work right out of the box. We bought it for one of our young adult kid's apartment and it is perfect. Simple to operate. This package wasn't available when we bought a $3,000 (including installation) super Elk M1 Gold system for our home. Had the iSmartAlarm system been available I would preferred the iSmartAlarm over the Elk.
customer_reviews.author: No Public name

customer_reviews.title: Security and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a more frustrating experience with a device. Sometimes the sensors detect the door as closed when they are, and sometimes they don’t. The app itself is completely unreliable. It freezes while I am trying to arm or disable the alarm. Apparently, there is a new update, but my app and device cannot be updated, for no apparent reason. This is a sham company and you should not waste your money on it. The message I received after contacting customer support was “we will do our best to get back to you within 48 hours.” Don’t spend your money here.
customer_reviews.author: pw

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and get a different system
customer_reviews.text: The system worked OK initially. It was easy to install the sensors, although a couple of them were finicky. I had to pull the battery and reinsert several times before it would connect. Recently the app has become slower and slower to respond, to the point that we’ve set off the alarm a couple times waiting for the app to do its job. As if that’s not bad enough, now the app will occasionally pop up ads when trying to turn off the alarm. Overall I like the concept of the system, but the execution leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: geoff

customer_reviews.title: while cool, is NOT reliable enough to rely on for ...
customer_reviews.text: If you want a system you can count on, this one isn't it! It's neat when it works, but it very problematic. Several time while on travel the iPhone notifications stopped working. A note to iSmart was replied to saying they were working the problem, but it took three day to reply to me and another couple of days before it started working again. This morning, about four months after purchase, all the spot cameras stopped working after they updated the App. This system, while cool, is NOT reliable enough to rely on for security.
customer_reviews.author: Gene A. Gottschalk

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it. Great quality of alarm.
customer_reviews.text: Will for one the motion sensor came with a dead battery. I replaced the three thriple a batteries in the sensor. The system has a delay on the alarm. I don't like that. Someone could come in my house and get tv and leave. 50 inches gone. It could happen.. I got my motion sensor in the barn. No more then 30 feet from from hub.the door and window sensors work perfect.the motion sensor not so will.
customer_reviews.author: joshua r.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs
customer_reviews.text: We've had this system for 6 months now. I researched for a long time before deciding on this one. We even tried a subscription alarm company. I love being able to control the alarm from my phone. I'm also glad we didn't keep the professionally monitored system because we tend to accidentally set this off fairly frequently. The best features are the push notifications when the doors are opened/closed and the camera. We keep one remote in the car and one in the main living area to turn the system on and off. We have the motion sensor in the garage. We're going to add a second camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jilly

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sent me an old version of this system
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble installing this and called ismart alarm customer support. They resolved the router problem and in doing so told me that I had an older outdated version of the product. I updated the firmware and then discovered the batteries in the sensors were all dead. The batteries are protected from going live by plastic inserts, so I guess the box I got was really on the shelf for a long time. First time I have been disappointed with Amazon. Jan. 28 update: Got new batteries for the sensors and the system is working perfectly. The telephone support from ismart is very good.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable don't waste your money like I did.
customer_reviews.text: This system never works properly. Sometimes the sensors work, sometimes the outlet plug connect, more rarely the cameras might actually pick up motion. If your looking to buy this for peace of mind, know you won't find it here. I have had so much frustration with this product. The tech support even said they know it has issues and engineers are working on firmware. This product is out long enough and still useless. Do yourself a favor and look for a a more reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher C Champagne

customer_reviews.title: worked great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for about 2 years now and usually worked pretty well. Today, the alarm simply stopped working. I've tried resetting the alarm and the sensors (which reconnected fine) but the main box (Smart Cube) has stopped responding. The app has also stopped working on my phone after a reinstall. I have a tough time recommending it, since it was good while it worked but has now shown its unreliability.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Nice system, quality control not so much. Two failures in first 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: The system works well, but either I have really bad luck or their QC needs some work. I ordered an extra motion detector with the package and it was DOA. Amazon promptly replaced that item. Now, two weeks in and one of the remote tags is dead. Removed and checked the battery: dead. No warning, no indication from the app that the battery was low. This was probably the problem with the motion detector, too. Clearly, this is not just defective or old batteries. There is something wrong that is draining the batteries. It's a shame, because the system works well, is easy to configure, and is a good price. Hope I don't lose any more devices.
customer_reviews.author: SSC

customer_reviews.title: Terrible app
customer_reviews.text: Bought this system about a year ago. The app is slow to arm or disarm the system at best, and totally unresponsive at times. It is a huge pain to use on a daily basis and often pesters you with ads for other products when you are trying to arm or disarm your system. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: jillbean

customer_reviews.title: Good potential, but competitors are gaining
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product and does what it says, but the dev team is missing some critical functionality they could so easily solve in software updates. They know it and their customers know it because they're posting great ideas and pointing out glaring omissions. They're responses are a bit slow for a young company. It shows there are resource issues and that's unfortunate because there are similar products on the rise that have just as much potential. The difference will be who reacts fast enough in every aspect to maintain the captured public imagination.
customer_reviews.author: iHelp Innovate

customer_reviews.title: Great value and worthwhile expense... no monthly charges.
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of my best investments this year. Knowing that my home is closed and secure is a good feeling, especially if I'm away. The option to add a camera is a nice touch as well. It takes a little doing to get everything set up, but it all took no longer than about 15-20 minutes to get it working. I did have an issue with the primary CubeOne unit, but iSmartAlarm took care of the problem tout-suite and I was up and running fast at no cost to me.
customer_reviews.author: BearCub

customer_reviews.title: Improved system!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this alarm a week ago, despite all the negative reviews. As I was installing the system today, I got an update from the company. I think this is the update people were waiting for because I am now able to control the arming time and whether or not I want the audible sound. I can also reduce the time my siren goes off once the alarm is tripped to 10 sec. I would have given this 5 stars, but the siren is quieter than I would like it to be, even with the volume on high. I'm glad this company is listening to its consumers and I hope to see more from them in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: g0ttadrift

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Device
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thing. I wanted something to alert me when certain doors are open/closed. This does the trick and can be used as a pretty decent alarm (which I know is it's primary function - but I don't use it for that purpose that often). Whenever my front door or garage door is opened, I am alerted no matter where I am. This way I know when my nanny has arrived with my kids she has picked up from school. I intend to expand with addition modules but right now I have two doors hooked up and so far the system has never really failed me. I don't have the camera because I already had one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are correct, it's not easy to set up but once it is, it's easy to use. The alarm is piercingly loud, which I appreciate. It does lose connection sometimes which maybe to my sucky Comcast internet. The best feature is that I can control it from the mobile app. And you can set up to get alerts for non-intruders come and go. Living alone in Chicago, it offers peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Green Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and was very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and was very easy to set up. Had a minor connection issue and was met with great customer service from the ismartalarm company. I am only giving 4 stars because the siren is soooo quiet. Luckily they have an additional speaker that can be connected just wish the built in one was louder.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, self monitoring alarm.. just needs external siren (which is coming soon based on feedback on website)
customer_reviews.text: Awesome system, where you get notified if any door open / close / alarm sounds / gets disconnected on your phone in seconds (You can also add multiple numbers for it to call when the alarm sounds, like neighbors)... It's like having a monitored alarm, but for free!! I know multiple people with the alarm now, and no complaints! Only Con is the remote siren has yet to be released (should be soon according to the website), so once that comes out, it's ready for prime time!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Guy 2005

customer_reviews.title: I like the system
customer_reviews.text: I like the system, never a problem with Apple's IOS interface but it does not interact with Android easily. After asking about it I get an email that tells me politely, in my words, to learn how to use my phone, because they claim it's the users issue to know how notifications work. Well I do know and I will tell android users that I tried it all and couldn't get it to interface the way it does with Apple.
customer_reviews.author: Jamison Matuszewski

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Took very little time to set up - just over an hour from start to finish for a newbie. I added an extra door sensor and a motion detector and the whole thing ran about $218 delivered. That was the best deal I found for similar products, and there's no monthly fee attached to this system. There are sticky pads to set up the door sensors, but on the doors at my house, I needed to add extra double sided sticky tape on one side of the sensors in order to get them to line up. That was my only issue, but I can't fault the device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ismart alarm , best system for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this system. One feature I like, the system maintains a connection over the internet. If someone was to cut my internet connection the system would sound alarm. I have had it for several months now and no fause alarms. I it went off lime 1 time for about 3 min I dont know why unless the internet modem reset automaticly which cause it to loose connection. I am thinking about buying a 2nd one for my brother. The company ae rdeveloping new sensor as I typ0e this review.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm system
customer_reviews.text: Great alarm system, it was easy to set up and I'm saving a ton of money (didn't even have to switch to geico). They have a good app that when fully set up will alert you via phone, text, email and in-app notification when the alarm goes off. ADT rips people off daily with these very same "premium" features. My only wish is that the alarm was louder.
customer_reviews.author: Don Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Great system, Garbage Batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. I set up and installed the system today. Everything works like a charm. I have it connected to Alexa directly and via IFTTS to make it easier to Arma do disarm. My only complaint is that one contact sensor and the motion sensor batteries were almost dead upon setting the system up which is annoying. I now have to take them back down to replace the batteries soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was about to return it but they had a good customer service which replaced everything
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smallest version just to try it out. Only the cube and one remote worked. The 2 door sensors, one remote and the motion sensor didn't work. I was about to return it but they had a good customer service which replaced everything. As far as the features of the alarm it's pretty good. Once I receive the last replacement I will finalize the installation of the system.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Excellent system / Worst Remotes (dumbest remote design in history)
customer_reviews.text: Love the system. Works as it should. Only problem is the key Fob remote. Terrible design on the remotes. Can't see the symbols on the buttons, chain loop on the wrong side of remote, really have to mash the button down to make sure it registered the action and buttons are not recessed so they get pushed in you pocket. Bottom Line: Excellent alarm system / Worst remotes anyone has ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Lynx

customer_reviews.title: It fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: After a few minor issues the first day or two that I had this alarm installed, the thing has been working perfectly. The app has a simple UI (there's some room for improvement in the log reporting, but it has a decent design and is easy to use). I was surprised and pleased with the small size of the sensors. Having used it for a few weeks now, I am wishing that I had bought the system with a camera. So I will likely be adding that in the future. For my situation, this system meets my needs at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Guo

customer_reviews.title: Raise some money
customer_reviews.text: The talking is our business business they were bank up now by Please do not buy me some money thanks
customer_reviews.author: boss

customer_reviews.title: This satisfied my need for an alarm system
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted text message notification of an alarm event and this device exceeds my expectations, it can do three things at once, text message, call my cell and leave a message, if I don't answer, and finally send an email. For my application it doesn't matter if the alarm is not loud or that the alarm can be unplugged, as I've already been notified by all three of the above.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome System!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Security System! Simply awesome! Unbelievable adaptability between the the smartphone app options and the IFTTT apps.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gommesen

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and no customer support
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned this system for several years and wish I would’ve purchased Simply Safe. The network is unreliable. It is down for days with no public notifications to update the status. Customer service is nonexistent.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: It's a little laggy but so far it works good. The alarm siren is a joke
customer_reviews.text: Installed premium package. Camera took some work. It's a little laggy but so far it works good. The alarm siren is a joke. It needs to be much louder as new homes are built with sound muffling sheet rock. There also needs to be a wi-fi siren that could be placed in a different room. Also. Key fobs are easily bumped in pocket no use for them with phone. Overall the wife and I are happy with it. I hope they listen to feedback because this could be a very good alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great idea
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a great idea; and the connection of the system was easy enough... however after a couple of days of testing and trying it out I have found that it will not STAY connected. It's alway notifying me that it's online and offline. My Homelink, my garage door opener, and thermostat stay connected and work flawlessly. This is not a reliable product and I wouldn't feel safe with it protecting my home due to the connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend
customer_reviews.text: Item does not work after firmware update. Searching online, it appears this is a known issue without any resolution found. I would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Techbuyer

customer_reviews.title: I love this system....
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5S Ipone to start with and a ASUS 1900 AC router which is pretty strong for wireless so I installed this system and I think it works better than other DIY wireless systems that I have had. I have a contact sensor on my shed door and it is about 200 ft from the base? Crazy and I really like it for its simplicity and mine works very well no problems. I just keep adding on to it lol!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had the iSmart system from the getgo (my crappy insurance co claimed I had to have a pro ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my small business to replace a commercial system - you know the ones where you pay a monthly fee for monitoring and pay a ton up front for install. Wish I had the iSmart system from the getgo (my crappy insurance co claimed I had to have a pro service, which is bunk). Easy to set up, has worked perfectly for the past several months. Much easier to arm and disarm than my previous system, and no false alarms - the "pro" system had tons of them. Got the camera too. App is nice. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I'm surprised by all the negative reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I'm surprised by all the negative reviews as my experience has been very positive. I've had the system for about a month now and it works as advertized. The installation of iSmartAlarm was incredibly easy. It took less than an hour. I installed an older wireless system from another company at my office and this system is far superior and easier to install. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Gee

customer_reviews.title: Good system
customer_reviews.text: This is a good system. Everything works as advertised. I immediately get a text message, phone call and email as soon as I trip the alarm. The only issue is the volume on the alarm. It is not very loud. If I burglar broke into the basement they would never hear the alarm. My alarm is on the second floor. And make sure you always have your cell phone on you. The alerts go to your cell phone. And if you don't pay attention. Someone can walk into your house, take your stuff, and leave before you ever know,it. I would get a separate camera system with this as back up
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Avril

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch Security System
customer_reviews.text: This is a great DIY security system! It was very easy to set up. It has been working very reliably for me for a few months now. No issues whatsoever. The only two things I would change would be for the remotes to have more resistance to the buttons like a key fob for a car because they push way to easily and there needs to be a sensitivity setting for the motion sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: This alarm system is the best going. So easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This alarm system is the best going. So easy to set up, sensors are good quality and the way it notifies you is fast. I have it calling three phones and they ring simultaneously. I also receive a text and email notification. Can't get better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Bergh

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but I don't love it
customer_reviews.text: Setup wasn't as easy as they would have you believe, but if you have any knowledge of electronics, you should be able to figure it out. App is still buggy, but the sensors and camera KEEP work as described (though one sensor came with a low battery). Siren isn't loud, but it doesn't need to be in order to scare burglers away. If the company can just focus on getting the app straightened out and reliable, I think the could have a good system. Other features like a water or glass breaking sensor is needed, and maybe even an outdoor camera. If you're looking for a middle-of-the-road system, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Busybody

customer_reviews.title: Am 100% satisfied with this purchase and my decision
customer_reviews.text: Am 100% satisfied with this purchase and my decision. I added a Spot Camera when they went on sale ($50) and coupled with this package I feel completely safe and protected. Would recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: M Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a toy. Not a loud siren
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and the whole system works fine. The only reason I just rated it with 3 stars is because the alarm (the real important piece of equipment) sounds like a toy. I live in a tiny one bedroom and the sound can be barely heard on the hallway. I wouldn’t imagine in a house. No one is going to hear it, and if they do they will think is a toy. So basically you have a theft notification app but not a sound that scared the intruder. My advice, make the siren be really loud, it's an alarm! Note: On the alarm settings is set up to be as loud as possible.
customer_reviews.author: ManuelBambu

customer_reviews.title: Great diy home security system.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Very easy to install. Easy to use app to control system. I get notifications every time a door or window is opened. I agree with another reviewer it helps to have a good quality home router with good coverage. I like the fact I can add to the system as I want. Plan on getting the new icamera when available. The best part is no monthly fees.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great System for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Great System for what it is! Super easy to set up and if you want to be the only one to monitor your system its fantastic! I had no trouble with add more sensors or the app. Its not super loud but I could hear it on the second floor - I later switch to simplisafe but I wanted it to be monitored
customer_reviews.author: A.Betz

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, easy maintenance and very user friendly using ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have wifi available you should have this. Easy setup, easy maintenance and very user friendly using cell phone. When someone needs to enter my home I can control from 1300 miles away. Awesome unit.
customer_reviews.author: cowboy

customer_reviews.title: App control without monthly fees
customer_reviews.text: Excellent alarm system. This is the only alarm I can find that allows online/phone app control without the monthly fee. Such a savings in the long run. The app can lag or be slow at times, but I don't use it as much as I expected since the system comes with two remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Redque

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this System
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this System!!! It works well for my needs. It is very prompt and accurate. The only con is I wish it had a key pad to enter a code then having to use phone or remote
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The iSmartAlarm System works great as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The iSmartAlarm System works great as advertised. Their Customer Service is Excellent. One of the remotes did not function out of the box and was corrected quickly with iSmartAlarm paying for both the return and shipment of the new remote. The Android App also works well with no problems found to date. Tony R, Granite Bay, CA
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind for home security
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with the app. Image quality is not the best. Pay extra for better cam but a bit pricey..
customer_reviews.author: QUANG NGUYEN

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it to a friend
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described. Easy to set up. Easy to use. Good directions. Took about 3 hours to set up but I went really slow because I had never set anything like this up. I set it up in a 2700 sq foot house. I would and have recommended it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Clean and simple system performing well with room to grow.
customer_reviews.text: A few hitches with setup. Help from iSmartAlarm Support was very good. System very clean and working as intended. I am eager to add a camera. Hope they introduce a smoke/CO detector, glass breaks, and wireless light switches soon. Using this at a remote weekend cabin in the hills. Perfect application.
customer_reviews.author: DLee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for apartment living!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for added peace of mind and it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great alarm value and works well.
customer_reviews.text: This alarm system works really well. It took me 30 mins to install everything and it's just worked since then. No false alarms, no messing with the settings. It's great and nice peace of mind. I'd like them to add new stuff to the kit. Garage door opener, thermostat, etc. More pieces to the same great system please!
customer_reviews.author: Al Diem

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this product. This product is a waste of money. We’ve experienced several network errors that make it completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good system
customer_reviews.text: This system works great for us. It is super easy to set up, I like how it goes off and calls me when a door or room is entered. Really good bang for the buck. I have had mine installed for about 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: therommy

customer_reviews.title: Security System that offers peace of mind and DIY installation !
customer_reviews.text: iSmartAlarm still works since I purchased it, so I bought a few more sensors.
customer_reviews.author: hella fan

customer_reviews.title: firmware and software upgrades included Room for improvement (would love to see
customer_reviews.text: Overall grade: 4/5 Highlights: No monthly fee; setup worked perfectly first time; integration with IFTTT; seems to be dependable; firmware and software upgrades included Room for improvement (would love to see, but not deal breakers): Key fobs are too easy to accidentally trigger; need to have separate settings for home/armed modes (i.e. I don't want to hear warning beeps for 30 seconds when I set the system to "home" mode); lack of battery backup
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A Buege

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for a DIY security system
customer_reviews.text: Stupid easy to set up! I set up the entire alarm system in 20 minutes. It has worked great so far. My brother in law has the same one and loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The battery in the key fobs don't last as long as we would have hoped though.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Willeke

customer_reviews.title: OK but needs improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and install of the basic system. Found instructions to be helpful and accurate. The remote tags need a redesign as it is far too easy to press a button accidentally. Also it is impossible to reboot the system remotely if you had a power dip. The message says to unplug and re plug the cube to reboot. This isn't possible if you aren't home. The alarm isn't loud enough to be heard unless you are indoors. Like the integration with my IPhone. Overall the system is OK but could be a whole lot better.

customer_reviews.title: Really like the system

product_meta.title: iSmartAlarm Preferred Home Security Package | Wireless DIY No Fee IFTTT & Alexa Compatible iOS & Android App | iSA3, White
product_meta.description:
The iSmartAlarm Home Security System is a DIY, self-monitored, self-controlled home security system, no monthly fees, no contracts required. The iSmartAlarm App allows the user to utilize their iPhone to arm, monitor and disarm their security system at any time, from anywhere, in real-time; the App shows who is at home, when family members left or returned and the on/off status of each sensor. The App will alert all designated members with a phone call, SMS message, push notifications and email when the iSmartAlarm security system detects a break-in or unauthorized activity and allows the user to view the home's status and safety with optional camera. It is open to future home automation features and almost unlimited expandability.

Note
Please upgrade the firmware to the most current version to ensure that you have the best experience with the product.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


INTEGRATED HOME AUTOMATION
iSmartAlarm is a convenient and effective method for monitoring a home and granting users control over devices in their home. Install iSmartAlarm wireless sensors in a home, apartment or dormitory and easily access real time feedback data on an iPhone or iPad.

The central hub of the iSmartAlarm system is the CubeOne, which connects to your home's router. CubeOne serves as the “brain” of you iSmartAlarm system and coordinates the activities of all connected sensors. The CubeOne can be expanded to control almost unlimited number of iSmartAlarm sensors.


ISMARTALARM, AT A GLANCE:
 * iSmartAlarm is a do-it-yourself (DIY), self-monitored, wireless home security system.
 * All sensors are designed to be easy to install and noninvasive to use.
 * Compatible with iOS 5.0 or later versions of iPhone or iPad (iPad won’t be able to receive phone call alert, SMS alert and verification code).
 * For US and Canada only (limited services to area code 867 and 907).






WHAT CAN BE MONITORED?
 iSmartAlarm was designed to monitor various objects around the home and the important people in your life. 

 Using the various sensors included in the preferred package, users can monitor and observe when a door, window, or cabinet is opened, or if movement is detected in a specified area. The remote tags can be attached to a key ring or bag to notify the system when family members leave or arrive home. Each remote can also be used to control home devices or activate the iSmartAlarm siren. 

THE ISMARTALARM PREFERRED PACKAGE COMES WITH:
 * 1 CubeOne Hub
 * 2 Window/Door Sensors
 * 1 Motion Sensor
 * 2 Remote Tags
 * 2 Sensor Stickers (for a yard or window)











HOW TO CONTROL
 The primary control for the iSmartAlarm system is your mobile device through a dedicated mobile app. A user with an iOS or Android device can arm, disarm, receive alerts, and monitor iSmartAlarm sensors at any time, from anywhere, in real time. The App will alert all designated members with a phone call, SMS message, push notifications and email when the iSmartAlarm security system detects a break-in or unauthorized activity, and allows the user to view the home’s status and safety with optional camera. Double tapping the siren will activate the 110dB siren if any emergency. 







FLEXIBLE AND CUSTOMIZABLE
 All iSmartAlarm sensors are wireless, mobile, portable and easily installed. In addition, the iSmartAlarm App is customizable. Provide names/nicknames and pictures every family member and device to give your home system a personal touch.
